result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Marvin Frank Tylke Jr in court.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Marvin Frank Tylke Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  
Case is in trial posture, defense counsel requests case be placed on the trial calendar.  Any pretrial motions to be filed by the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 13.
Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for January 25, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report, filed.

Defendant Marvin Frank Tylke Jr in court.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Marvin Frank Tylke Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Tyler Tabin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court vacates stayed warrant. Court addresses Justice Point report, updated contact information provided to the Court. Defense is requesting an additional status to review discovery with defendant. Case is adjourned in Branch 13.
Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on August 31st, 2022

Defendant Marvin Frank Tylke Jr not in court.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Marvin Frank Tylke Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. No appearance by the defendant.  Defense has discovery and offer. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed until the next court date.  Case adjourned to Br. 13.
Calendar call scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report - received and filed
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Home Depot - Wauwatosa; Rickie W.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.

Defendant Marvin Frank Tylke in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Marvin Frank Tylke in custody at Manitowoc County Jail.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marvin Frank Tylke appeared by video means with Attorney.  Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  MCSO did not provide executed warrant at time of scheduling.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Letter from defendant re:  clearing warrant on this case.  (Marvin F. Tylke, Jr. - #86900, Manitowoc County Jail, 1025 S 9th St, Manitowoc WI 54220).
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Marvin Frank Tylke not in court.  Matthew Richard Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/16/2022@2pm
